definition: (of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)

sentences.english: His Adam's apple bobbed in his throat.
sentences.chinese: 他的喉結在喉嚨裏上下滾動。

sentences.english: The official name for the Adam's apple is the prominentia laryngea.
Why Do Men Have an Adam's Apple But Women Don't?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼男人有喉結而女人沒有呢？

sentences.english: Technically, everyone has a prominentia laryngea, even if it's not visible.
sentences.chinese: 學術上來說，每一個人都有喉結，即使喉結相當隱蔽。

sentences.english: Technically, everyone has a prominentia laryngea, even if it's not visible.
sentences.chinese: 學術上來說，每一個人都有喉結，即使喉結相當隱蔽。

sentences.english: I find that your Adam's apple isn't apparent.
sentences.chinese: 我發現你的喉結不明顯。

sentences.english: Father tried to make Henry laugh by moving his Adam's apple up and down.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸把他的喉結上下移動，逗得亨利哈哈大笑。

sentences.english: But does it do anything? Not really.
sentences.chinese: 可是喉結真的很重要嘛？

sentences.english: Usually the Adam's apple jump is a sign of anxiety.
sentences.chinese: 通常喉結跳動是焦急的信號。

sentences.english: Ronnie swallowed hard. He’d just started developing an Adam’s apple, and he could feel the knot pogo in his throat.
sentences.chinese: 在羅尼這個年紀，喉結纔剛開始發育。

sentences.english: She aimed at his adam's apple and the tip of her toe hit him somewhere below his jaw.
sentences.chinese: 她朝他的喉結踢去，腳指尖踢到了他下巴的某個地方。

sentences.english: An empty fold of skin hung from his chin to his Adam's apple.
sentences.chinese: 從下顎到喉結，他的皮膚鬆弛地垂了下來。

sentences.english: Hence four the elder brother also ignore Adam apple that of rankle, Doudoune Moncler Femme, close behind made trace for up.
sentences.chinese: 於是四阿哥也不管喉結那的疼痛，緊跟着就追了上去。

definition: voice change (at puberty)/to alter one's voice (deliberately)/to sound different (when angry etc)
to twitch/to throb/a spasm/to extract and use
too weak to stand up to the wind (idiom); extremely delicate/fragile state of health
body palpation (diagnostic method in TCM)/tactile examination
to shake/to fling one's arm/to lash/to swing
